cc.text: Amazing quote from "Last Child in the Woods"

"Eventually, most of us figure out that it's people, not nature, who create morality, values, ethics --- and even the idea that nature itself is something worth preserving. We choose to be shepherds and stewards, or we don't. We will ive wisely --- preserving water and air and everything else intrinsic to the equations we're only beginning to understand --- or we won't, in which case Nature will fill the vacuum we leave. She is exquisite, and utterly indifferent."
-- Seth Norman, quoted in Richard Louv, "Last Child in the Woods", p. 290.
